title: FTSE LIVE: Asos profits tumble 68%; Woodford quits two other funds
text:
It's been a challenging year for former stock market darling Asos, as two profit warnings and operational errors wiped nearly 50 per cent off its share price.

In today's full-year results, the online fashion firm confirms a 68 per cent slump in profits for the year to August 31, but sales jumped 13 per cent.

And after being fired from his main fund on Tuesday, stock picker Neil Woodford last night dramatically quit the other two funds which bear his name – Patient Capital Trust and Income Focus.

Meanwhile, expect more volatility from the pound today as Brexit talks resume for one final day ahead of the all-important EU summit, where any draft deal would need to be approved by European leaders.

Expect more volatility from the pound today as Brexit talks resume for one final day
